---

## GAD-7 vs CAST

In the realm of psychological and social science research, comparing different assessments such as the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Cannabis Abuse Screening Test (CAST) plays a significant role. However, the process of comparing and harmonising these research instruments can be tedious and time-consuming. Thankfully, the Harmony software tool has been developed with these challenges in mind, to bring convenience and efficiency to the process. Harmony leverages powerful technologies, including natural language processing and generative AI models, to streamline and automate the process of harmonising questionnaire items, even across different languages. It works by comparing each item across these measures and providing a percentage match. Thus, comparing GAD-7 vs CAST becomes a simpler and more efficient process. This software can greatly enhance the utilization and effectiveness of longitudinal studies by enabling accurate comparisons both within and across studies. So when it comes to GAD-7 vs CAST comparisons, Harmony offers a practical solution for researchers. The software's database is home to a variety of instruments, including GAD-7 and CAST. Alternatively, researchers can upload their own instruments in PDF format via the web interface, broadening their options and flexibility. Harmony's language capabilities also remove barriers in multi-language studies. When conducting research in the interface of anxiety disorders and substance abuse, GAD-7 vs CAST comparison, researchers just might find Harmony to be an indispensable tool.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
